moduleDescription: This module covers the process of developing a project from its inception to its commissioning, and the financing of projects. It provides students with an understanding of the economic and social aspects and implications of how properties and infrastructure are developed and managed. The topics include: land use planning process, property development process, and roles of governments and parties involved in the built environment. The module also covers the fundamental issues relating to capital budgeting, use of projects as investment instruments, project feasibility studies, cash flows, investment criteria, cost of capital, and how various types of projects are financed.
